NAME: Chinatown Heritage Centre, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture at the Chinatown Heritage Centre.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Learn more about local Chinese culture at the Singapore Chinatown Heritage Centre.
META_DESCRIPTION: At the Chinatown Heritage Centre, experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture.
OPENING_HOURS: Daily, 9am – 8pm,Last entry at 7pm.*Chinatown Heritage Centre will be closed for renovation from 1 October 2014 till end-2015.

NAME: Thian Hock Keng Temple, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Beautifully restored, Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Thian Hock Keng Temple in Singapore is dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.
META_DESCRIPTION: Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.

NAME: Eurasian Heritage Centre: Singapore Attraction
DESCRIPTION: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Discover the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
OPENING_HOURS: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 6pm, Closed on Monday

NAME: Shophouses
DESCRIPTION: With many beautifully preserved examples on hand today, the shophouses in Singapore are prime examples of timeless architectural appeal.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The varying styles of Singapore's shophouses are a showcase of our evolving architecture.
META_DESCRIPTION: Few buildings epitomise our culture as fully as the shophouse, with its surprisingly harmonious mix of diverse design elements.

NAME: Capitol Building Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The queen of Singapore cinemas will soon reclaim her crown as the premier entertainment hub when Capitol Building reopens next year.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Capitol Building's distinctive facade adds a touch of grandeur to the cityscape.
META_DESCRIPTION: Now undergoing massive restoration works, Capitol Building will emerge as Singapore’s premier entertainment hub next year.

NAME: Esplanade Theatre
DESCRIPTION: This boldly designed performing arts centre has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Catch a world-class opera or pop concert at Singapore’s premier performing arts centre.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Esplanade is boldly designed performing arts centre that has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.

NAME: Gardens by the Bay
DESCRIPTION: The lush and beautiful Gardens by the Bay is dominated by the sleekly sculptured biodomes – marvels of architecture, design and engineering.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Gardens by the Bay seamlessly blends sleek design, cutting-edge technology and fun.
META_DESCRIPTION: Biodomes, baobabs and the blossoming bounty of every conceivable plant will bowl you over at Gardens by the Bay.

NAME: The Interlace
DESCRIPTION: There’s more than meets the eye in The Interlace’s artful arrangement of residential blocks.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Few buildings demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking as well as The Interlace, an intriguingly designed residential complex.

NAME: PARKROYAL on Pickering
DESCRIPTION: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Pamper yourself and save the world at the same time at PARKROYAL on Pickering.
META_DESCRIPTION: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.

NAME: Lasalle College of the Arts
DESCRIPTION: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Lasalle College of the Arts pushes the boundaries of creativity in architecture
META_DESCRIPTION: Lasalle College of the Arts evokes awe with its bold, graphic lines and stunning reinterpretation of nature.
OPENING_HOURS: Administration Office, Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm. Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours

NAME: Old Supreme Court Singapore
DESCRIPTION: From dispensing justice to displaying art, the Old Supreme Court undergoes an overhaul for its new role as the National Gallery Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Old Supreme Court lends a stately presence to the heart of Singapore city.
META_DESCRIPTION: Due to reopen as the National Gallery Singapore, the Old Supreme Court is in itself a masterpiece of classical art.

NAME: SIT Flats Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Take a walk back in time through the Art Deco architecture in the heritage neighbourhood of Tiong Bahru.
ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Seng Poh Road and Tiong Bahru Road
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The charm of Tiong Bahru comes to life through its Art Deco architecture.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Art Deco elegance of the flats in Tiong Bahru speak of the richness of a vanished world.

NAME: Lau Pa Sat Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The grande dame of markets in Singapore, Lau Pa Sat blends history, striking architecture and scrumptious local food into one heady experience.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Lau Pa Sat blends graceful colonial architecture, heritage and delicious food.
META_DESCRIPTION: The historic market Lau Pa Sat offers a winning combination of graceful colonial architecture, a longstanding heritage and delicious food.

NAME: Malay Heritage Centre, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Delve into the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
OPENING_HOURS: Malay Heritage Centre Museum, Tuesday to Sunday, 10am – 6pm, Closed on Monday, Malay Heritage Centre Compound, Tuesday to Sunday, 8am – 8pm, Friday and Saturday, 8am – 10pm, Closed on Monday

NAME: Peranakan Museum Singapore: History & Culture
DESCRIPTION: Get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and history at this top-notch museum, filled with fine artefacts and fun exhibits.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Many communities, one nation. Find out more about our people, such as the ubiquitous Peranakans.
META_DESCRIPTION: At the Peranakan Museum, get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and its eclectic culture and history with fun and interactive exhibits.

NAME: Raffles Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Hark back to a golden age of elegant refinement and gracious living at Raffles Singapore, where the past reawakens to glorious life.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The iconic Raffles Hotel has been home to both tall tales and famous folks.
META_DESCRIPTION: Sip a Singapore Sling beneath the whirling fans at the Long Bar, and let the tranquil charms of Raffles Singapore bring you back into another era.

NAME: Gillman Barracks – YourSingapore
DESCRIPTION: A former British military camp is now Asia's new Destination for Contemporary Art.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Gillman Barracks Singapore is Asia’s vibrant new destination for the creation, exhibition and discussion of contemporary art.
OPENING_HOURS: Tuesday to Saturday, 11am - 7pm, Sunday, 11am - 6pm , Galleries closed on Monday and public holidays.

NAME: Pinnacle@Duxton
DESCRIPTION: The soaring lines and stunning views of majestic residential estate Pinnacle at Duxton will make you forget your fear of heights. Almost.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Pinnacle@Duxton's architecture is a refreshing change in a sea of concrete blocks.
META_DESCRIPTION: With its lofty towers and dizzying sky gardens, the Pinnacle at Duxton takes residential living to soaring new heights.

NAME: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
DESCRIPTION: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque will captivate you with its intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque in Singapore features an intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences.
META_DESCRIPTION: With its tilting European-style minaret and Chinese tiling, the Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the most unique mosques in Singapore.

NAME: Haw Par Villa: Singapore Theme Park
DESCRIPTION: Embark on an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology at the Haw Par Villa theme park.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: A visit to the Haw Par Villa theme park is an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology.

NAME: NUS Baba House - Singapore Peranakan Architecture
DESCRIPTION: This heritage house lends rich insight into Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts make the NUS Baba House a must-visit.
META_DESCRIPTION: NUS Baba House is a heritage house that gives a rich look at Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.
OPENING_HOURS: Visits are by appointment only.Visitors must sign up in advance for heritage tours which fall on:Monday, 2pm – 3pm,Tuesday, 6.30pm – 7.30pm,Thursday, 10am – 11am,Saturday, 11am – 12pm

NAME: Hong San See Temple Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Restored by expert craftsmen from China, the Hong San See temple has been brought back to its full glory.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Dancing dragons and prancing phoenixes are just some of the visual delights to catch at the exquisitely restored Hong San See temple.

NAME: Chinese Heritage Centre, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Explore questions on ethnic identity such as what it means to be a Chinese.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.
OPENING_HOURS: Monday to Friday, 9.30am – 5pm,Saturday and Sunday, 10am –5pm, Closed on public holidays

NAME: Kampong Glam & Malay Culture in Singapore

META_DESCRIPTION: Discover the heart of Singapore’s Malay community, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in vibrant Kampong Glam.

NAME: Contemporary Arts Center

META_DESCRIPTION: The Contemporary Arts Center at the Nanyang Technological University uses a variety of medium to explore contemporary art.

NAME: Red Dot Design Museum, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: This museum holds more than 1,000 award-winning products, communications and concepts that will delight design fans.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Award-winning exhibits at the Red Dot Design Museum in Singapore are sure to delight design fans.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Red Dot Design Museum holds more than 1,000 products and items that are winners for their good design.

NAME: Singapore Art Museum

IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Get to know the works of contemporary artists around Southeast Asia at the Singapore Art Museum.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Singapore Art Museum houses the world’s largest public collection of contemporary Southeast Asian artworks.

NAME: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay
DESCRIPTION: Catch a non-stop line-up of world-class performances at Singapore’s premier arts centre.

PHOTOCREDITS: Mori Hidetaka, Courtesy of Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay
META_DESCRIPTION: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay is the country’s premier arts centre as well as an iconic landmark on the city’s skyline.

NAME: National Design Centre, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The National Design Centre is the nexus for all things design. It hosts design exhibitions, events and programmes that will quicken the pulse of design lovers.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Explore the wonderful world of design at the National Design Centre, Singapore.

NAME: Victoria Theatre Singapore
DESCRIPTION: After a four-year refurbishment, the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has since reopened, with its first official concert held there in August 2014.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Catch world-class performances at stunning venues, like The Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall.
META_DESCRIPTION: The historic Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has been transformed to meet the needs of a modern audience.

NAME: NUS University Museum, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at this museum on the campus of the National University of Singapore.
ADDRESSSTREETNAME: 50 Kent Ridge Crescent, National University of Singapore
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The NUS Museum in Singapore houses more than 8,000 exhibits that take you back to the past.
META_DESCRIPTION: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at NUS Museum at Singapore’s leading university.

NAME: Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall
DESCRIPTION: This revamped museum is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall pays tribute to the revolutionary leader.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.

NAME: Asian Civilisations Museum & Singapore Museum
DESCRIPTION: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum tells the stories of Asian civilisations through its permanent collections.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Asian Civilizations Museum, Singapore is a historic building that tells the story of Asian civilisation.
META_DESCRIPTION: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum is a microcosm of Asian civilisations spread over 11 galleries.

NAME: National Museum of Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s oldest museum is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The National Museum of Singapore building is also an architectural icon that is stunning to behold.
META_DESCRIPTION: The National Museum of Singapore is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.
OPENING_HOURS: Singapore History Gallery Daily, 10am – 6pm,Last admission at 5.30pm.Singapore Living Galleries Daily, 10am – 8pm Free admission from 6pm –8pm , Last admission at 7.30pm

NAME: The Japanese Cemetery Park
DESCRIPTION: Located in Hougang, this is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia and the burial ground of Singapore’s early Japanese community.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Japanese Cemetery Park holds the ashes of thousands of Japanese soldiers, marines and airmen killed during World War II.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Japanese Cemetery Park is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia, containing nearly 1,000 graves of Singapore’s early Japanese community.

NAME: Dalhousie Obelisk, a Singapore Landmark
DESCRIPTION: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Dalhousie Obelisk is a historically significant piece of Singapore architecture.
META_DESCRIPTION: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.

NAME: Raffles Statue – Sir Stamford Raffles Landing Site
DESCRIPTION: The sculpture depicts Sir Stamford Raffles, founder of modern Singapore. Two statues exist, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Raffles Statue depicts the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles. Two statues exist today, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.

NAME: Singapore Philatelic Museum
DESCRIPTION: The Singapore Philatelic Museum offers windows into Singapore and the world through stamps.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Take a colourful trip back in time at this Singapore museum dedicated to postage stamps and related materials.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Philatelic Museum offers visitors postage stamp-sized windows into Singapore and the rest of the world.

NAME: Old Ford Factory Singapore Museum
DESCRIPTION: The Old Ford Factory holds an archive of memories about Singapore's wartime occupation by the Japanese.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The site of the first Ford plant in Southeast Asia, the Old Ford Factory in Singapore is a journey to the past.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Old Ford Factory is a repository of memories about the hardships endured during the Japanese Occupation of Singapore.

NAME: Singapore Coins and Notes Museum & Museum Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The rare collection of currencies on display here tells Singapore’s story through the money it has used over the years.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Explore the city of Singapore through its coins and notes over the years at the Singapore Coins and Notes Museum.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Singapore Coins and Notes Museum tells the story of Singapore through the currencies it has used over the years.

NAME: Singapore City Gallery
DESCRIPTION: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.

NAME: Changi Museum Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Explore our wartime past by learning about the Fall of Singapore and the infamous Changi Prison.
META_DESCRIPTION: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.

NAME: MINT Museum of Toys Singapore & Toy Museum
DESCRIPTION: This toy museum will delight both adults and kids with the vast collection of vintage toys and memorabilia from around the world.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: More than 50,000 vintage toys from as many as 40 countries are on display at this Singapore toy museum.
META_DESCRIPTION: Singapore's MINT Museum of Toys' vast collection of vintage toys will delight both kids and adults.

NAME: Lim Bo Seng Memorial
DESCRIPTION: This gazetted national monument at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Lim Bo Seng Memorial commemorates one of Singapore's heroes from World War II.
META_DESCRIPTION: The gazetted Lim Bo Seng Memorial at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.

NAME: Kranji War Memorial Landmark in Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The serene Kranji War Memorial, Singapore is a hillside cemetery set in a quiet neighbourhood.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.

NAME: Indian National Army (INA) Monument in Singapore
DESCRIPTION: This marker at Esplanade Park was one of the eleven World War II markers erected in 1995 to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The Indian National Army Monument tells an intriguing story of Singapore's past.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Indian National Army (INA) Monument at Esplanade Park is a memorial that was built in 1995 to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.

NAME: Reflections at Bukit Chandu: Singapore War Memorial
DESCRIPTION: This heritage centre relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Reflections at Bukit Chandu is housed in a lovingly restored colonial bungalow.
META_DESCRIPTION: Reflections at Bukit Chandu relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.
OPENING_HOURS: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 5.30pm,Closed on Monday (except on public holidays)

NAME: The Cenotaph - a Singapore War Memorial Landmark
DESCRIPTION: This war memorial in Esplanade Park honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Surrounded by lush green, The Cenotaph sits at a quiet spot amid the city buzz.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Cenotaph in Singapore is a war memorial in Esplanade Park that honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.

NAME: The Civilian War Memorial park in Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Situated at the War Memorial Park in Beach Road, this memorial commemorates civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation in Singapore.
ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Bras Basah Road & Beach Road intersection
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: The Civilian War Memorial and park in Beach Road commemorates Singapore’s civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation during World War II.

NAME: Maghain Aboth Synagogue
DESCRIPTION: The Maghain Aboth Synagogue is a gem in more ways than one, providing both a snapshot of history and a glimpse into a rich culture.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: The simple exterior of the Maghain Aboth Synagogue gives no indication of its richly elegant interiors.

NAME: CHIJMES Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Whether functioning as a school or a lifestyle and entertainment complex, it appears the beauty of CHIJMES is only equalled by its versatility.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The charm of CHIJMES, Singapore harks back to a bygone, gracious age.

DESCRIPTION: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at this premier exhibition space.

NAME: SAM at 8Q & Singapore Art Museum

NAME: Cruises from Singapore

NAME: Sungei Buloh
DESCRIPTION: This ecological wonder will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Get up close with a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat at this Singapore Garden.
META_DESCRIPTION: The ecological wonder of Sungei Buloh will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.

NAME: S.E.A. Aquarium
DESCRIPTION: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and discover more than 100,000 marine animals.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Explore a world rich with animal and plant life at the Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve.
META_DESCRIPTION: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and take a look into the planet’s largest window to the ocean.
OPENING_HOURS: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.

NAME: Singapore Botanic Gardens
DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s oldest garden is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s Botanic Gardens is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.
OPENING_HOURS: Singapore Botanic Gardens Daily, 5am - 12am National Orchid Garden Daily, 8.30am - 7pm(last ticket sales at 6pm)Jacob Ballas Children's Garden Tuesday to Sunday, 8am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)Closed every Monday (except when it falls on a designated public holiday)SBG Heritage MuseumDaily*, 9am - 6pm*Closed every last Monday of the month (except when it falls on a designated public holiday, it will be closed the following day)

NAME: Singapore Zoo: Attractions & Things to Do
DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s zoo is a beautiful, award-winning wildlife park, where animals can roam freely in their natural habitats.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: The award-winning Singapore Zoo lets you see your favourite animals in all their natural wonder.
META_DESCRIPTION: Catch animals in their natural habitats at the award-winning Singapore Zoo.

NAME: River Safari Singapore
DESCRIPTION: At the River Safari Singapore, meet manatees and monkeys, piranhas and pandas, as they congregate in and around the park’s waters.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Meet manatees, monkeys and more as you ride the world's rivers at River Safari, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: The River Safari Singapore is a fascinating new wildlife park that recreates life in and around the world’s rivers.

NAME: Cable Car Singapore & Mount Faber
DESCRIPTION: Getting to this hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car  is half the fun.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Spend a unique evening overlooking spectacular views on a cable car in Singapore's Mount Faber.
META_DESCRIPTION: Getting to the hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car is half the fun.

NAME: Night Safari, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Instead of going to a club, pop into another popular nightspot, the Night Safari, and mingle with a different crowd of animals at this special zoo.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Enter a world of nocturnal creatures at the Night Safari, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: Head to the Night Safari for an after dark visit to the weird and wonderful creatures of the night.
OPENING_HOURS: Daily, 7.30pm - 12am .Last ticket sale at 11.15pm.F and B and retail outlets open from 5.30pm

NAME: Pulau Ubin & Singapore Islands
DESCRIPTION: Gravel roads, lush forests and abundant wildlife – Pulau Ubin is a living showcase of what Singapore was like in the 1960s.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Hop on a bumboat to the island of Pulau Ubin if you want a taste of nature and rustic village life, away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore.

NAME: Little India Singapore: History & Culture
DESCRIPTION: Little India is a buzzing historic area that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community from vibrant culture to incredible shopping.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Immerse yourself in the rich culture of Little India, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: Little India is a buzzing historic district that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community, from vibrant culture to ethnic-inspired shopping.

NAME: Orchard Road, Singapore: Asia's Most Famous Shopping Street
DESCRIPTION: Orchard Road, Asia’s most famous shopping street, is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Orchard Road, Singapore is nothing short of a shopper's paradise.
META_DESCRIPTION: Don’t miss a trip to Orchard Road. Asia’s most famous shopping street is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.

NAME: MacRitchie Singapore & Singapore Nature Reserve
DESCRIPTION: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir is a playground of nature for those who love the outdoors.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: MacRitchie Reservoir is nature’s playground for those who love the great outdoors.
META_DESCRIPTION: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir caters to fitness fanatics, water sports enthusiasts and nature lovers.

NAME: Gardens by the Bay
DESCRIPTION: This sprawling garden in the city provides mesmerising waterfront views across three gardens, spanning over 101 hectares of reclaimed land.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Be mesmerised by stunning waterfront views at the award-winning horticultural destination that is Gardens by the Bay.
META_DESCRIPTION: Gardens by the Bay provides mesmerising waterfront views across three gardens, spanning over 101 hectares of reclaimed land.
OPENING_HOURS: Bay South Outdoor Gardens Daily, 5am - 2am Cooled Conservatories and OCBC Skyway Daily, 9am - 9pm(last ticket sale at 8pm).Far East Organization Children's Garden Tuesday* to Friday, 10am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)*Closed on Tuesday if a public holiday falls on the preceding Monday Weekends and public holidays, 9am - 9pm(last admission: 8.30pm)

NAME: Civic District, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage started.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Immerse yourself in a day of history and culture at the Civic District, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage starts.

NAME: HarbourFront, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a regional ferry or simply want to eat, shop or relax.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: HarbourFront, Singapore is your exciting gateway to entertainment and Singapore's outlying islands.
META_DESCRIPTION: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a ferry to the outlying islands or simply want to eat, shop or relax.

NAME: Bras Basah.Bugis, Singapore Cultural District
DESCRIPTION: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the arts and heritage district in Singapore's civic centre, and home to museums and monuments.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: There’s nowhere else quite like shopping at Bugis.
META_DESCRIPTION: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the vibrant arts and cultural district in the heart of Singapore's civic centre, and home to top museums and monuments.

NAME: National Gallery Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.
OPENING_HOURS: Effective from 24 November 2015, Sunday to Thursday and  public holidays,10am - 7pm ,Friday to Saturday and  eve of public holidays, 10am - 10pm

NAME: Universal Studios Singapore™ Theme Park
DESCRIPTION: Step into the glamorous world of movies at this world-class theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa™.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie theme park offers a dizzying selection of entertainment offerings.
META_DESCRIPTION: Universal Studios Singapore™ at Resorts World™ Sentosa is a movie-themed entertainment park that the whole family can enjoy.
OPENING_HOURS: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.

NAME: Singapore Science Centre
DESCRIPTION: This enlightening attraction holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Adults and kids of all ages who are not even science buffs will have fun at the Singapore Science Centre.
META_DESCRIPTION: Singapore Science Centre holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in the country.
OPENING_HOURS: Science Centre Singapore Daily, 10am – 6pm(last admission: 5.15pm) .Omni Theatre Daily, 12pm – 6pm (last show: 6pm) . Snow City Daily, 10am – 6pm (last admission: 5pm) School and public holidays, 10am – 7pm (last admission: 6pm)

NAME: Fuk Tak Chi Museum & Places of Interest
DESCRIPTION: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Marvel at the Fuk Tak Chi Museum's carefully restored architecture in the heart of Chinatown.
META_DESCRIPTION: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.

NAME: Katong Antique House Singapore: Peranakan Heritage
DESCRIPTION: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Marvel at antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection at the Katong Antique House.
META_DESCRIPTION: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.

NAME: Chinese Garden Singapore
DESCRIPTION: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Step back in time to ancient China at the beautiful Chinese Garden, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.

NAME: East Coast Park Singapore
DESCRIPTION: With so many attractions packed into this 15-km stretch of beaches, you’ll never run out of things to do.
ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Whether you prefer water sports, rollerblading or cycling, find a myriad of things to do at East Coast Park, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: With so many attractions packed into the 15-km stretch of beaches at East Coast Park, you’ll never run out of things to do.

NAME: Fort Canning Park
DESCRIPTION: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic landmark on a hill is full of surprises.
ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Bounded by Hill Street, Canning Rise, Clemenceau Avenue and River Valley Road
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Take a stroll back in time at Fort Canning Park, Singapore - a landmark full of history.
META_DESCRIPTION: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic Fort Canning Park has something for everyone.

NAME: Kusu Island, Singapore
DESCRIPTION: If you’re looking for local heritage off the beaten track with a good dash of nature, Kusu Island hits the spot.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: Kusu Island lies to the south of Singapore, and has a wonderful mix of local heritage and beach activities.

NAME: Jurong Bird Park, Singapore: Attractions & Things to Do
DESCRIPTION: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Enjoy close encounters with some of our prettiest and rarest feathered friends at the Jurong Bird Park.
META_DESCRIPTION: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.

NAME: HortPark
DESCRIPTION: Lose yourself in this dreamscape of stunning gardens that will make you forget the bustle of city.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Escape the buzz of the city at HortPark, Singapore.
META_DESCRIPTION: HortPark is a gorgeous collection of stunning gardens and plants that will make you  forget about the bustle of city.

NAME: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore
DESCRIPTION: Make a big splash at this aquatic adventure park at Resorts World™ Sentosa.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Adventure Cove Waterpark™, Singapore is the perfect place to have fun with loved ones.
META_DESCRIPTION: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore at Resorts World™ Sentosa promises a day of wet and wild fun in the sun.

NAME: Lasalle College of the Arts
DESCRIPTION: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Lasalle College of the Arts pushes the boundaries of creativity in architecture.
META_DESCRIPTION: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
OPENING_HOURS: Administration Office Monday to Friday, 9am – 6pm.Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours.

NAME: Singapore River: History & Culture Tours
DESCRIPTION: Get to know historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. After all, this is where it all began.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Take a stroll along the Singapore River and see how the city came to be.
META_DESCRIPTION: Get to know the historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. This, after all, is where it all began.

NAME: Joo Chiat/Katong: Singapore Peranakan Neighbourhood
DESCRIPTION: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in this charming corner of eastern Singapore.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Spend a day exploring heritage shophouses and quaint stores at Joo Chiat/Katong.
META_DESCRIPTION: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in Joo Chiat/Katong, a charming corner of eastern Singapore.

NAME: Sentosa Island, Singapore: Leisure & Attractions
DESCRIPTION: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Get ready for laughs, thrills and loads of fun in the sun at Sentosa Island.
META_DESCRIPTION: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination, with more than 500 hectares filled with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa.

NAME: Chinatown Singapore: History & Culture
DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s historic Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and markets as well as cool stores and cafes.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: Chinatown, Singapore is a bustling mix of old-world charm and modern delights.
META_DESCRIPTION: Singapore’s legendary Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and night markets as well as cool stores and cafes.

NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum in Singapore
DESCRIPTION: This Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown gets its name from what the Buddhists regard as the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT: NA
META_DESCRIPTION: The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum is a Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown that gets its name from the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.
